title.narrative: 2.1 INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO PROVIDE IMPROVED ADOLESCENT, MATERNAL, INFA

description.narrative: 2.1 Caregivers and communities have increased knowledge and skills to provide improved adolescent, maternal, infant and young child nutrition and care practices

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Nepal Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Nutrition)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Nepal 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Nepal Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.1 Caregivers and communities have increased knowledge and skills to provide improved adolescent, maternal, infant and young child nutrition and care practices

description.narrative: Nepal made strong strides to improve breastfeeding promotion, with maternity protection ensuring 98 days of paid maternity leave in both public and private sector, 196,405 children were exclusively breastfed, 201,873 children received timely initiation of complementary feeding, 331,710 caregivers of 0 to 23 months children were counseled for IYCF and 45 percent of expected pregnancies 43 percent of 758,652 expected pregnancies received nutrition counselling along with IFA 180 plus tablets. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF
Percentage of health and nutrition workers trained to provide IYCF counselling services as per national standards
Number of service delivery points (health facility or community) that provide IYCF counselling
